field.value: AspView: viewcomponent parameter names being compared without case sensitivity

field.name: description
field.value:
The viewcomponent parameter dictionary passed to viewcomponent instance use default equality comparer.
I propose to use case insensitive comparison as most of the AspView view engine allready work without case sensitivity (as plain asp.net with server controls).
example:
<component:diggstylepagination page="<%=paginationcontext%>"></component:diggstylepagination>
raise an error saying 'Page' is required parameter
The attached patch solve this issue by passing an implementation of IEqualityComparer<string> that perform according comparison (the implementation is embeded because I didn't find such one in the .net framework).
Also, what is the preferred way for asserting that in the new testfixtures? (I would do the according testcase)
If the patch is rejected, would an option on the aspview configuration section be accepted?
Thanks
